title: Arsenal vs Aston Villa prediction: How will Premier League meeting play out?
text:
Aston Villa travel to London to face Arsenal at the Emirates Stadium on Sunday afternoon.

Villa have a strong away record against Arsenal, winning three times on visits to London in the Premier League - a record bested only by Manchester United and Chelsea (four times).

Arsenal come into the game having not won any of their last three Premier League games, but they did pick up a morale-boosting win against Eintracht Frankfurt in the Europa League.

Alexandre Lacazette remains a sizeable absentee, while Kieran Tierney and Hector Bellerin are still working their way back from injury.

Here is all the information ahead of the game at the Emirates.

Team News

Unai Emery will still be without Alex Lacazette, Hector Bellerin and Kieran Tierney. He rotated heavily in midweek, with the likes of Sokratis, Mesut Ozil and Nicholas Pepe all set to come back into the side.

Villa have been boosted by the return of Matt Targett, who has not featured since his move from Southampton in the summer.

Dean Smith also has Trezeguet available, after he missed the West Ham game through suspension.

Predicted Line-ups

Arsenal – Leno; Maitland-Niles Sokratis, David Luiz, Kolasinac; Guendouzi, Ceballos; Pepe, Ozil, Nelson; Aubameyang​

Villa – Heaton; Guilbert, Engels, Mings, Taylor; Douglas Luiz, McGinn, Grealish; Jota, Wesley, Trezeguet

When is it?

Kick off between Arsenal and Villa is 4.30pm on Sunday September 22.

How can I watch it?

Due to the Chelsea vs Liverpool match kicking off at the same time, no UK channel will be broadcasting the game live.

Highlights will be available to watch on Match of the Day 2 on Sunday night at 10.35pm on BBC One.

Odds

Arsenal 2/5

Draw 4/1

Villa 7/1

Our Prediction

Arsenal and Villa both tend to play expansively, so we can expect this game to be open with chances for both sides.

Bjorn Engels and Tyrone Mings have impressed for Villa at the back, but will face their toughest test yet in Aubameyang and Pepe, with the latter keen to get his first goal for the club.

Wesley has come under some criticism since his move from Club Brugge, but faces an Arsenal defence that have looked shaky in every match and may be able to profit.

Arsenal 3-1 Villa

Arsenal will need to improve on their last league game, a 2-2 draw at Watford where defeat looked likely despite having been two goals up. Aubameyang is chasing the golden boot once again this season. A hat trick today would take him level with Aguero on eight. Aston Villa will be looking to move out of the relegation zone. Their only league win came against Everton just under a month ago. Lacazette injured, but Aubameyang and 18 year old Saka produced the goods in Germany on Thursday. The latter an exciting prospect. Another big day for him against Villa.
